poem:
The Walk to Parkhead

In the shadowed halls where light once danced,
Silence wraps the empty rows.
Glasgow to Bedford,
Swindon to Yate,
Specters of celluloid fade,
The screen's silence now speaks  
of dreams,
reel-less in the dark.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Cineworld to close six UK cinemas in cost-cutting drive Cineworld has said it will close six venues across Britain as part of a plan to cut costs, as the debt-laden chain continues to struggle with the headwinds facing the cinema industry. The affected sites will be Glasgow Parkhead, Bedford, Hinckley, Loughborough, Yate and Swindon – Regent Circus. In a statement, the company said it aimed to return to profitability and “ensure a sustainable long-term future". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Cineworld to close six UK cinemas in cost-cutting drive Cineworld has said it will close six venues across Britain as part of a plan to cut costs, as the debt-laden chain continues to struggle with the headwinds facing the cinema industry.
